bug.author: deepdad
bug.summary: Creating a Notebook Server doesn't end loading.
bug.description:
Using the setup here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3901#issuecomment-521200663>#3901 (comment)</denchmark-link>
It seems that Quick shortcuts > Create a new Notebook server > [enter a name, leave the rest as is] results in a spinner before the listed notebook servers but not much more. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22483621/63019503-ccff4300-be9b-11e9-9c30-a884002487c6.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.95. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

2:04:23 PM create Pod test2-0 in StatefulSet test2 failed error: pods "test2-0" is forbidden: error looking up service account default/default-editor: serviceaccount "default-editor" not found test2 1:52:17 PM create Pod test-0 in StatefulSet test failed error: pods "test-0" is forbidden: error looking up service account default/default-editor: serviceaccount "default-editor" not found test

How did you create the namespace? Did you create a profile to create the namespace? The profile is what populates the namespace with appropriate service accounts <denchmark-code>kubectl get profiles </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deepdad>@deepdad</denchmark-link>
I meet the same problem,too. If you use default namesapce, you could try to kubectl create sa -n kubelfow default-editor. Maybe it will solve the problem.
A number of issues with namespaces and RBAC are fixed with 0.7.0. Please try 0.7.0 and if you are still having problems open a new issue.
